column4: I want to recompile my kernel (gutsy). I did apt-get source linux-image-2.6.22-14-generic. It gives me a diff.gz file. How do I apply those diffs against the kernel source tree?
why do you want to build your own kernel
if you do so you will lose ubuntu community support
no problem then
was recompiling kernels back in '94, just not ubuntu ones!
Patch is the command
yeah, I did patch -p0 -v < linux......diff, but that didn't apply it, it just gave loads of "already applied" warnings
is it already applied then ?
lol. that's what I was just wondering. Let me check...
I think you may find it is
lol. It is already applied. And how much time I've wasted on that one! Thx
no problem
just rename the file
that easy? Okay.
it may not hurt to use the "append" parameter in the .config to change the running kernel name to differentiate between the ubuntu one
so if I just do append=uv1, I'll get uv1 in the filename?
no, the append parameter is in the .config at compile time
Okay, so I add it to the .config I generate?
you don't add it, in the menuconfig or xconfig (whatever you used) there is an append option to append your own name to the kernel title
okay. (I just edited debian/config/i386/config and ran debian/misc/oldconfig 386)
what did you edit ?
linux-source-2.6.22-2.6.22/debian/config/i386/config
but what did you do to the file
but you didn't use the append option ?
